summary:
Slytherins aren't always sassy bitches
Hufflepuffs aren't always a tiny baby with flowers in their hair
Ravenclaws aren't always...
body:
Slytherins aren’t always sassy bitches

Hufflepuffs aren’t always a tiny baby with flowers in their hair

Ravenclaws aren’t always depressed students with good grades

Gryffindors aren’t always stupid hoes with no impulse control

blog.name: quasi-normalcy
blog.title: Frenzied Flitting From Topic To Topic
blog.description: Physicist. Historian. Aspiring writer. Mediocre Poet. Self-Fancied Polymath. Terminal Nerd. Flamboyantly Asexual Trans woman. Canadian, but living in Scotland. You may call me "Your Majesty," but "Jaime" will also suffice.

title: Outlaw Kings and Rebellion Chic
excerpt: by Alister MacQuarrie // The revolutionary is everywhere in pop culture, but revolutionary politics are conspicuous by their absence - or by their vilification.
description: The closer rebel characters come to a definable ideology, the more likely they are to be written as villains. At the same time, the emotive aspects of rebellion - the heroism of the underdog, the thrill of fighting the power - are rendered safe for public consumption by taking out any explicit political ideology. Even when rebels jump out of the screen, like the Guy Fawkes masks borrowed from V for Vendetta by real protestors, they are often diluted. In the transition from comic to film to symbol of protest, the more detailed exploration of anarchism in the original text is lost, leaving a void that can be filled by a wide variety of groups whose only common thread is opposition to authority. The effect of all this is to suggest that violence is somehow more sympathetic the less its perpetrators believe - that heroism decreases the more detailed your policy proposals get. If Luke Skywalker was fighting for galactic communism, or Daenerys intended to create a series of peasants’ councils to govern Westeros, or Harry Potter wanted to smash the Ministry of Magic and overturn wizard supremacy, we would have to confront serious and difficult questions about when political violence is appropriate, for whose benefit, and for what purposes. I don’t believe those are questions pop culture is incapable of asking. They are questions we do not want to ask.

FAQ

unforgivably cursing you with our existence since 1965

as seen in Bo Burnham's Eighth Grade, apparently

we have a Discord server! join here! (15+ only please)

we track the tag 'accioshitpost' (without a dash) so if you have art or a fic based on of one of our posts, pop it in there and we'll reblog it for you! we always appreciate your creativity!

you can find our amazon wishlists here and here - if you get us anything, we'll post a picture and a thank you note!!

if you want to follow our personal blogs, here's Roxie's, here's Persephone's, and here's Jamie's

nazis, terfs, pedos, and anybody happy to defend or stand by them can leave. we don't want you. avada kedavra, shithead.

now in blue raspberry flavours, hitting stores soon!

tags: i don't know what i'm doing with my life
summary: It was a sunny day of August. The streets were almost empty. "Lovely", she thought, enjoying the lack of sounds, as she held her...
body:
It was a sunny day of August. The streets were almost empty. “Lovely”, she thought, enjoying the lack of sounds, as she held her baby daughter by the hand. “Just a quiet day in the playground”. As mother and daughter stepped their foot on the grass, the small child ran ecstatically towards the swings. The mother with the young face, gracefully sat on the nearest bench, taking a magazine out of her backpack. “We can’t stay long, honey. Dad is waiting for us to have dinner”. The girl on the swing started going higher and higher, as if that would make up for the short time she had. Suddenly, she saw her mom’s friend approaching the bench she was sitting on, and felt a rush of happiness, knowing that she had more time than she initially thought.

Back and fourth she went on the swing, seeing the sky come and go. She finally stopped because she got bored. Her eye glanced the nearby slide. She saw her mother engaging in conversation with her friend, so she thought she wouldn’t mind. She approached the slide but before she could hop on it, a hand grabbed her and started running with her towards the exit opposite of the one she came in with her mom. She let a scream out; her mom stood up as if the bench was burning her bottom. She started screaming, too. “Annie!” She couldn’t see her. She ran towards every corner of the park. “Help! Help!”, she screamed. “They took my baby!!”

A man who was walking alone alongside the park, saw the man running on one end, and the mom screaming on the other; it didn’t need much thought. He funnily ran towards the man, yelling at him to let the girl go. The man in front simply turned his head, saw the tall, black haired man behind him, and with an expression of panic, clumsily let the girl fall on the ground. He then proceeded to run twice as fast, without looking back, hoping to simply vanish from sight.

The man with the long black hair immediately stopped and stood on top of the little girl who was now calling for her mommy with an empty expression. “I’ll take you to her, do not worry. You are safe”. He took her hand, and as he saw her head tilting he felt sorry for her. As the screams of the mother grew nearer and nearer, they started going faster, as if they were medicine and her agony was pain.

“Oh my God Annie! Who took you? What happened? I’m so sorry baby, mom will never leave you again!” Her friend was a few steps behind, looking relieved and puzzled by the tall man’s presence. The mother stopped hugging her child and looked at the man above them; he calmly explained what he had just witnessed. The crying woman stared at him and after a few seconds of silence, she asked him: “Are y- are you Severus Snape?” The man was startled. “Why, yes. It is I. There’s no need to thank m-” The woman interrupted him immediately. “I’d never thank a toad killer. You only saved her because you felt guilty of your own past”. The man who now looked frozen, watched her leave with her child and friend on each side. She was a snater.

summary: Drarry Discord Writer’s Corner Drabble Challenge - April-19 Melted
title: Drarry Discord Writer’s Corner Drabble Challenge - April-19 Melted
body:
Prompt: Just Right

word count: 100

Thanks to Jay for the beta work!  

Read on AO3

 It’s freezing in here. The transfigured mattress is thin and does nothing to keep the cold from the floor at bay. I wish I would have won the bed, but luck is never with me.

 He whimpers. I remember he said the cold makes the nightmares worse. I swallow my pride and creep into the bed although I swore I would never share it, not even for all Gringotts’ gold. I crossed my fingers though, that should count.

 I cover both of us with my blanket; soon he calms and fits his body with mine. Everything’s warmer. Everything’s just… right.

blog.name: my-hogwarts-mystery
blog.title: My Hogwarts Mystery - Megan Fry
blog.description:
Hello everyone, and welcome to My Hogwarts Mystery. My name is Megan Fry and I'm a student at the Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry, representing Ravenclaw (and not because blue and black looks great on me). Hopefully you'll all enjoy getting to see everything I get up at Hogwarts and maybe we'll get to meet each other along the way.

(Disclaimer: This Tumblr is not based on real life and none of the events that happened on here ever actually happened, except on the Harry Potter: Hogwarts Mystery App, but can be told in a different content for entertainment. This is mainly just for entertainment purposes and to not be taken too seriously.)

(Warning: Posts on here are likely to contain inappropriate language/phrases.)

summary: First time going to Ollivanders and getting my first wand. It was like love at first sight, for the wand that is. For me, it was...
body: First time going to Ollivanders and getting my first wand. It was like love at first sight, for the wand that is. For me, it was more like a companion in a less romantic way.

summary:
Draco: 

Ugh, remind me again why we’re doing this Harry: Because we love Pansy Draco: ... Harry: Okay, because she threatened...
body:
Draco:  Ugh, remind me again why we’re doing this

Harry: Because we love Pansy

Draco: …

Harry: Okay, because she threatened us with a very painful death if we didn’t help her and we’re cowards

Inspired by rockmarina’s prompt list

summary: If Harry Potter was a Slytherin
body:
If Harry Potter was a Slytherin

“HARRY POTTER DID YOU PUT YOUR NAMEIN THE GOBLET OF FIUREEE”

“No.”

“YOU MUST COMPETE AS YOUR NAME WAS CHOSEN. “

“Yeaaaa.. nah”

“YOU MUST”

“Yeah but like… make me? I have prior engagements sooo nothanks “
